newsitem.title: GREECE: ALPHA CREDIT BANK KEEPS PRIME RATE UNCHANGED.
newsitem.headline: ALPHA CREDIT BANK KEEPS PRIME RATE UNCHANGED.

text.p: Greece's Alpha Credit Bank will keep its prime rate for working capital and fixed asset loans unchanged at 12.50 percent effective Monday, it said in a statement.
Alpha Credit, which reviews its rates weekly, said the maximum add-on would remain unchanged at 3.5 percent.
Its adjustable mortgage mortgages were steady at 13 percent.

The bank launched 15-year mortgages in October 1995 with rates set at 12.0 percent for the first five years. Rates on these mortgages currently stand at 10.50 percent. --Angelos Kiosklis, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
